path_1.title: The Landlord (2007)
path_1.feeling: A one-joke premise that wore thin fast.

path_1.feeling: A few winces and laughs, mostly numbing gross-out repetition.

path_1.feeling: Charming enough, but the familiar beats didn’t stick with me.

path_1.title: Sausage Party (2016)
path_1.feeling: Clever idea, but the juvenile gags drowned it out.

path_1.title: Fred Claus (2007)
path_1.feeling: Sappy holiday fluff with scattered laughs.

path_1.feeling: Sharp, offbeat crime comedy that kept me engaged.

path_1.title: I Know What You Did Last Summer (1997)
path_1.feeling: Formulaic teen slasher with limited suspense.

path_1.title: Vanilla Sky (2001)
path_1.feeling: Intriguing mind-bend, muddled in its own haze.

path_1.title: Interstellar (2014)
path_1.feeling: Ambitious and affecting at times, but uneven.

path_1.title: Miss Sloane (2016)
path_1.feeling: Taut and sleek, though a bit heavy-handed.

path_1.title: Clean Slate (1994)
path_1.feeling: Fun premise, mostly forgettable execution.

path_1.title: I Know What You Did Last Summer (1997)
path_1.feeling: Still too generic to grab me.

path_1.title: Entanglement (2018)
path_1.feeling: Offbeat and occasionally affecting, but uneven.

path_1.feeling: Fish-out-of-water fun dulled by standard-issue action.

path_1.title: Uncle Buck (1989)
path_1.feeling: Warm-hearted and funny enough to work.

path_1.feeling: Serviceable, familiar beats with little surprise.

path_1.title: Eighth Grade (2018)

path_1.feeling: Some sharp spoofing, but too sketchy to fully land.

path_1.title: Colossal (2016)
path_1.feeling: Interesting concept, emotionally detached for me.

path_1.title: Carlito's Way (1993)

path_1.title: Kindergarten Cop (1990)
path_1.feeling: Cute idea, mostly corny laughs.

path_1.feeling: Overlong and self-serious without the payoff.

path_1.feeling: Compassionate and quietly powerful character study.

path_1.title: City Slickers (1991)
path_1.feeling: Pleasant midlife-cowpoke diversion, light on impact.
